body:
Hello everyone,
A lot of people have been saying negative things or having negative thoughts about the Avicore update. I want to make the coming updates perfect this plugin, and in doing so I want the community's help. Please respond some of the problems you see with Avicore, and some of the issues you want us to fix. I will gladly present all of these ideas, changes, and fixes to Funky, and I will respond to you what the staff thinks about these ideas. We all want the same thing, whats best for the community, and this is most likely the best way to make this plugin and server perfect.
Now, I kindly ask all of you to stop ranting about how Avicore didn't meet your expectations and isn't as good as you thought it was going to be. I understand that having an opinion isn't against the rules, but it does get quite annoying when it gets posted in a topic that is completely unrelated. Please comment (kindly) what you feel about the Avicore update, and please provide real problems that the staff team can provide answers for. We don't want Avicus hate or unreasonable requests on this thread, but we do encourage any other problems or requests you have.

replies.body:
/where will be re-added soon. We must have just forgot to put it back in.
The donor flying was replaced with trails. Those are much more fun. I don't think flying will be re-added. Sorry if this saddens you (Shouldn't sadden non donors?)
Secrets caused a bit of lag in the lobby, so we took them out. We tried to make the lobby have less secrets to allow players to actually play the game and not waste too much time. The lobby also got really cluttered in the end, and it annoyed a lot of the staff members (me included).

replies.body:
May I ask a few questions?
1. Golden Apples aren't dropping anymore for most maps. Was this intentionally done? I know that the regular apples were replaced with Golden Apples that cost 8 points, kinda expensive for just 3 pieces and the fact that there are no more golden apple drops is kinda harsh to a surviving player. I'd like to think of them as an award rather than killing heaps just to get a few bits of regen. Just a thought. They are not dropping upon killing an enemy. They are kept soulbound. 

2. I think the block-placing pace should not be controlled because what happens if you naturally just place blocks quickly? It just despawns from the whole battlefield leaving you vulnerable. Let's say making an outpost or a bridge. It makes things slower and more difficult.

So I would like this to be stopped, because it ruins the games a bit.

LG Forscher

replies.body: There are people who sucked at aiming at their target that they just throw them all and wadah! they missed or sometimes they only hit one person and that person even didnt die. Ky, if you're a donor, you can tell how hard to throw and aim them to enemies who are good at dodging or when they're too close if they're wearing iron/diamond armor. One time i was trying to throw grenades at my friend and he survived by dodging. That's one of the cons of grenades. Easy to dodge if you practice. Also another con is, for 5 grenades, it will took you 10 points to get it and you can only kill 1-2 person if you suck at targeting. but for some people who are good at throwing grenades, they can kill 5 people with it or even more. Grenades are annoying but you can still dodge it by strafing it.

I find the anti cheat really annoying now, almost every game i get teleported while bridging and end up falling into the void at least once. It has also happened to me while i was stacking straight up.

Also, i don't like how some of the McZone maps have changed, like in Crusade they changed the stonebrick to a mixture of a bunch of different types of stone blocks, and it just looks ugly imo. They also changed Frostbite, but it's not the bedrock i don't mind, it's just that they moved the spectator spawn. replies.body:
@MetallicPenguin Parkour was originally on MCZone, but was never finished. I don't think it deserves it's own gamemode, but if we could find a twist to put it in Avicade I bet it'd be real fun. Sky Wars isn't really that popular, however if we were to re-add it I think it'd also fit in avicade; the only issue is the length of the games and if it would really be worth it bringing it back. (Unofficial word here..)

@RagingLumberjack It is indeed hosted in the United States, however I believe funky said a while back on Oldvicus that if we were to get another server, it would be hosted in Europe.

@cowcowl Blame Mojang's skin servers. I don't think it's a problem on Avicus's end.
@Tekcrezec162 It's most likely the amount of players and the maps themselves. Some maps are non-laggy and some aren't. Claustrophobia and World's End have smooth framerate, while some others can impact you bad. As for #2, you can probably see it once the stats command comes back. You are able to know how much XP you get after a match ends. For #4, I agree and hopefully we can make it less boring. Right now, we just have pets and holograms. I was thinking hats, jump pads, and lounges. For #5, I believe it's hardcoded however you can always request new kits on the forum. And.. for #6.. I don't really know, probably a coincidence.

replies.body:
If someone is trying to make a long written thought out post on the forums and then they copy and paste a link to say a picture, video, etc. Once they paste the link all there paragraphs come together and all the "Enters" they pushed to make the different spaces for those paragraphs. An Example:


Hey guys! I just made a video! I will now press enter four times to make a new paragraph and tell you what the video is about.This video is a Website Tour of the new website for Avicus! I will now press enter four times for a paragraph saying Enjoy!I really hope you guys enjoy this video! I will now post the link to the video in the next paragraph. Here is the link to the video:https://www.youtube.com/


If I didn't put the enters back in the Bug Find above the jumbled paragraph it would look like this.


Never seen the /trails in action. Maybe in the shop you should add links to pictures so people could see what some of the perks do. Such as /trails. replies.body: There is one thing that bothers me MUCH here and I am nearly gone because of this. There are way to much hackers here and also mostly the wrong people are accused of hacking. For instance, 2 days a go in Unix(Nebula) A leather guy fighted against 2 diamond guys(including me) and won(He didn't knock us over the edge) I alone had given him about 10 hits with my diamond sword. But strangely no one thought, that he could be a hacker.
